intro: Lygistum hispidum, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences.
